intro: Psychotria phyllanthoides, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
